definition: Tang emperor Xuanzong's 唐玄宗[Tang2 Xuan2 zong1] reign name used during the Kaiyuan era (713-741), a peak of Tang prosperity

to open/to start/to turn on/to boil/to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc)/to operate (a vehicle)/carat (gold)/abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1 er3 wen2]/abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1 ben3], book format
currency unit (esp. Chinese yuan)/first/original/primary/fundamental/constituent/part/era (of a reign)/meta- (prefix)/(math.) argument/variable/(Tw) (geology) eon
surname Yuan/the Yuan or Mongol dynasty (1279-1368)

sentences.english: Kai Yuan Real Estate is full of life.
sentences.chinese: 開元地產厚積薄發，蓄勢而上。

sentences.english: Parking is available on a first-come, first-served basis along tree-lined Kai Yuan Road.
sentences.chinese: 停車位是沿着開元路上，總是先到先得。

sentences.english: In the history of the tang dynasty was formed "kaiyuan time" boom.
sentences.chinese: 歷史上的唐朝之所以形成“開元盛世”的繁榮景象。

sentences.english: There was a beautiful girl named Yang Yuhuan who was selected into the palace in Tang Dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 唐朝開元年間，有一美貌女子叫楊玉環，被選進宮來。

sentences.english: We are now at the Kaiyuan Holiday Resort by the side of Qiandao Lake.
sentences.chinese: 我們現在是在千島湖開元度假村。

sentences.english: The Three-hundred Year Past of Dama Lanterns of Kai-Yuan …
sentences.chinese: 臺南開元寺法燈錄三百年史。

definition: imperial order
An-Shi Rebellion (755-763) of 安祿山|安禄山[An1 Lu4 shan1] and 史思明[Shi3 Si1 ming2], a catastrophic setback for Tang dynasty
Tianshun Emperor, reign name of eighth Ming Emperor 朱祁鎮|朱祁镇[Zhu1 Qi2 zhen4] (1427-1464), reigned 1457-1464, Temple name Yingzong 英宗[Ying1 zong1]
Tang and Song dynasty provincial governor, in Tang times having military and civil authority, but only civil authority in Song
Daguan district of Anqing city 安慶市|安庆市[An1 qing4 shi4], Anhui
Yongle Emperor, reign name of third Ming emperor Zhu Di 朱棣[Zhu1 Di4] (1360-1424), reigned 1403-1424, Temple name 明成祖[Ming2 Cheng2 zu3]
Chongzhen, reign name of last Ming emperor (1628-1644)
surname Qin
to respect/to admire/to venerate/by the emperor himself
capital of a country (literary)
cloud/CL:朵[duo3]
surname Yun/abbr. for Yunnan Province 雲南省|云南省[Yun2 nan2 Sheng3]
Baoying county in Yangzhou 揚州|扬州[Yang2 zhou1], Jiangsu
death of king or emperor/demise
Eastern Jin dynasty 317-420
Qiantang River that loops around Hangzhou 杭州[Hang2 zhou1] in Zhejiang Province 浙江省[Zhe4 jiang1 Sheng3]
the current dynasty
